showcase.title: Boids
showcase.name: boids
showcase.author: Oliver Cass
showcase.description: A simple XR program demonstrating the flocking nature of birds using the boids algorithm. Built on top of the A Frame framework. Boids is an artificial life program, developed by Craig Reynolds in 1986, which simulates the flocking behaviour of birds. His paper on this topic was published in 1987 in the proceedings of the ACM SIGGRAPH conference. The name "boid" corresponds to a shortened version of "bird-oid object", which refers to a bird-like object.
